et: probably reduction of {it}bageard, badgerde{/it}, from {et_link|badge:1|badge:1} + {et_link|-ard|-ard}; from the white mark on its forehead
shortdef: any of various burrowing mammals (especially Taxidea taxus and Meles meles) of the weasel family that are widely distributed in the northern hemisphere
the pelt or fur of a badger
a native or resident of Wisconsin —used as a nickname

dt.t: … the mill foreman so taunted the workers, so {wi}badgered{/wi} them and told them that they dared not quit …

pt: {sc}bait{/sc} {sc}badger{/sc} {sc}heckle{/sc} {sc}hector{/sc} {sc}chivy{/sc} {sc}hound{/sc} mean to harass by efforts to break down. {sc}bait{/sc} implies wanton cruelty or delight in persecuting a helpless victim.
{sc}badger{/sc} implies pestering so as to drive a person to confusion or frenzy.
{sc}heckle{/sc} implies persistent annoying or belligerent interruptions of a speaker.
{sc}hector{/sc} carries an implication of bullying and domineering.
{sc}chivy{/sc} suggests persecution by teasing or nagging.

et: from the sport of baiting badgers
